council_profile.transaction_profile: Highest transaction volume despite lowest total spend — many small payments from vehicle hire and fuel micro-payments.
council_profile.note: Pendle publishes over £500 threshold. The high transaction count is driven by individual vehicle rental charges and fuel fill-ups.

data_quality.note: Good data quality. Full descriptions provided for all transactions.

ch_breach_spend.note: Lowest breach spend of the 3 councils. Minor compliance issues.

split_payments.note: Requires manual review. High instance count likely inflated by vehicle hire payment patterns.

year_end_pattern.note: March spending is flat — exactly at the monthly average. April is the peak month. No year-end budget rush whatsoever.

transaction_volume_anomaly.note: Highest of 3 councils despite lowest total spend (£125M). Driven by: Go Plant Fleet Services (210+ identical £3,540 vehicle hires), FUELMATE (5,047 individual fuel fill-ups at £159 avg), Riverside Truck Rental (133+ identical charges). These are individually invoiced operational costs, not duplicates.

go_plant_fleet.note: Vehicle hire — 210+ identical monthly charges per vehicle. NOT duplicates.

fuelmate.note: Individual fuel fill-ups. Most frequent supplier by volume.

cross_council_context.note: Most shared suppliers of the 3 councils. Liberata contract is the key comparison with Burnley.
